document.masterDocTitle: Caayguara, a new genus of huntsman spiders from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest (Araneae: Sparassidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Caayguara, a new genus of huntsman spiders from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest (Araneae: Sparassidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype :
ɞ from Estação Biológica de Boracéia, Salesópolis [
23 º 37 ' S
;
45 º 52 ' W
], São Paulo, Brazil ,
18–24 May 2001
, Equipe Biota leg. ( IBSP 54408 ).
Paratypes :
5 ɞ, 5 Ƥ, with the same data as holotype ( IBSP 54414 ; 54504–54505 ; 54509–54510 ; SMF ; MZSP 31780 ); 1 ɞ, 1 Ƥ, Vale do Jurubatuba [
25 º 51 ' 53 " S
;
46 º 18 ' 15.7 " W
], Santos, São Paulo,
March – December 2007
, A.A. Nogueira leg. ( MZSP 31781 ).

Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the Tupi Indian language that means “mountain inhabitant”, and refers to the distribution of this species along the coastal mountains of São Paulo.

Diagnosis . The males of
Caayaguara ybytyriguara
sp. nov.
resemble those of
C. itajucamussi
sp. nov .
by the general conformation of the male palp, with RTA lacking both dorsal and ventral branches and embolus with a triangular subdistal projection ( Figs 49 , 54 ; sp). They are distinguished from the latter by the RTA with a triangular subdistal lobe (
Figs 54–55
; sl) and by the embolus with an inconspicuous pars pendula and small ventral keel (
Fig. 54
; ppl, vk). The females are distinguished from the remaining species of the genus by the touching part of the lateral lobes more than twice as long as the small median septum (
Fig. 56
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 54–58.
Caayguara ybytyriguara
sp. nov.
54 male, left palp, ventral view (sp = subdistal projection; vk = ventral keel; VTA = ventral tibial apophysis); 55 ditto, retrolateral view (sl = subdistal lobe); 56 female, epigynum, ventral view; 57 ditto, vulva, dorsal view; 58 schematic course of internal duct system. Scale lines: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Males (n = 10 ): total length 8.1–10.5 ; prosoma 3.6–4.3 ; femur I 6.5–7.2 . Females (n = 10 ): total length 7.9–11.6 ; prosoma: 3.7–4.8 ; femur I 4.6 –6.0.
